appDescription: A mobile-first chat application designed to connect the Indian community within different states in the USA. It features state-specific public chat rooms, private messaging, and dedicated pages for community needs and offers.

coreFeatures.description: User registration and login via email and password. Session persistence is handled by Firebase Auth. Includes password reset functionality.
Users have profiles with first name, last name, username, email, phone, city, state, and a profile picture. Profiles are editable.
State-specific public group chat rooms (e.g., 'california', 'texas'). Users join based on their profile's state. Supports text and image messages.
Users can initiate one-on-one private chats with other users. Private chat history is accessible from a dedicated 'Personal Chats' screen.

A dedicated page that displays community needs. Users can manually post new requirements (e.g., 'Jobs', 'Housing') through a form. They can also filter requirements by category. This page serves as a community needs board.
A page displaying special deals and offers for the community. Admins can add, edit, and delete offers. Non-admin users see a CTA to contact an admin to post an offer.
A protected page for administrators. It displays a log of detected spam messages. Admins can also add new offers directly from this dashboard.
A mobile-friendly bottom navigation bar provides easy access to Chat, Requirements, Offers, and Profile. An Admin link appears for authorized users.

firestore.description: Room ID is the state name for public chats (e.g., 'hawaii') or a composite ID ('uid1_uid2') for private chats.

schema.title: string
schema.states: array<string> (list of state values, e.g., ['california', 'texas'], or ['all'])

securityRules.description: Defines access control for the Firestore database.

permissions.write: Allow only if the user is modifying their own document (request.auth.uid == userId).

permissions.read: Allow if the user's UID is in the `users` array of the parent chat document (for private chats) or if it's a public chat.
permissions.write: Allow if the user is authenticated and the message belongs to them.

permissions.update: Allow if user is an admin.
permissions.delete: Allow if user is an admin.

permissions.write: Allow if user is an admin.
